text: オゾン注入 / 濃度増加しています / 効いてる効いてる
translation: Ozone injection. / Concentration is increasing. / It's working, it's working!
grammar: Repeating a verb (効いてる効いてる) adds emphasis and excitement, showing real-time observation.

text: いける / か
translation: Can we do this? / Hmm...

vocabulary.meaning: to be able to manage, to work out

grammar: いける is casual potential form meaning 'it can work' or 'we can do this'. The か at the end adds uncertainty.

text: 0Aと0Bは回復しそうです / パイプ周り正常地に戻りました / やはり中心部は強いですね / よしオ / ゾンを増やせ
translation: 0A and 0B look like they'll recover. / The pipe area has returned to normal. / As expected, the central part is strong. / Alright, increase the ozone!
grammar: 〜そうです expresses conjecture based on appearance ('looks like it will...'). 増やせ is imperative form of 増やす.

text: 変ね
translation: That's strange...
grammar: ね at the end seeks confirmation or expresses contemplation. 変ね is a common expression of puzzlement.

text: あれ / 増えてるぞ! / 変です! 発熱が高まってます! / 汚染域! また拡大しています!
translation: Huh? / It's increasing! / Something's wrong! The heat is rising! / The contaminated area! It's expanding again!
grammar: ぞ is a masculine sentence-ending particle adding emphasis and urgency. てる is casual form of ている.

text: ダメです! まるで効 / 果がなくなりました! / 今度はオゾンをどんどん吸っています! / オゾン止めて!
translation: No good! It's become completely ineffective! / Now it's rapidly absorbing the ozone! / Stop the ozone!
grammar: まるで...ない means 'not at all' or 'completely not'. どんどん is an onomatopoeia expressing rapid progression.

text: すごい… 進化しているんだわ…
translation: Incredible... It's evolving...
grammar: んだわ is feminine sentence ending expressing realization or explanation. The ん (explanatory の) adds emotional weight.

text: どうしたの!? / サブコンピューターがハッキングを受けています! 侵入者不明! / こんな時に… くそ! Cモードで対応!
translation: What happened!? / The sub-computer is being hacked! Intruder unknown! / At a time like this... Damn! Respond with C-Mode!
grammar: を受けています is passive progressive, showing ongoing action being done to the subject.

text: 防兵器を解凍します! 疑似エントリー展開! / 疑似エントリーを開始されました / 逆端まで18秒 / 防壁を展開 / 防壁を突破されました / 疑似エントリーをさらに展開します / 人間技じゃないぞ
translation: Thawing defensive weapons! Deploying decoy entry! / Decoy entry has begun. / 18 seconds until breach. / Deploying firewall. / Firewall breached! / Deploying additional decoy entries. / This is superhuman!
grammar: 人間技じゃない literally means 'not human skill/technique' - an expression meaning something is beyond human capability.

text: 逆端に成功 / この施設内です / B棟の地下 / プリブローボックスです
translation: Backtrace successful. / It's within this facility. / Basement of Building B. / It's in the Pribnow Box.
grammar: Noun + に成功 means 'succeeded in (noun)'. 施設内 uses 内 (ない) as suffix meaning 'within'.

text: 光学模様が変化しています / 光ってるラインは電子回路だ / こりゃコンピューターそのものだ / 疑似エ / ントリー展開 / 失敗 妨害されました / メインケーブルを切断
translation: The optical pattern is changing. / The glowing lines are electronic circuits. / This thing IS a computer! / Decoy entry deployment failed - we were blocked. / Cut the main cable!
grammar: そのもの after a noun emphasizes 'the thing itself' or 'nothing but'. こりゃ is casual contraction of これは.

text: ダメです 命令を受け付けません / レーザー打ち込んで / ATフィールド発生 効果なし / 保安部のメインバンクにアクセスしています / パスワードを操作中
translation: No good, it's not accepting commands! / Fire the laser! / AT Field generated - no effect. / It's accessing the security department's main bank. / Manipulating passwords.

vocabulary.meaning: to fire into, to drive in

grammar: 〜中 (ちゅう) after a verb stem or noun means 'in the middle of doing'. 効果なし is telegraphic speech omitting particles.

text: 12桁 16桁 Dワードクリア / 保安部のメインバンクに侵入されました
translation: 12 digits, 16 digits, D-word cleared! / Security department's main bank has been infiltrated!
grammar: Passive form されました indicates the action was done to them (the bank was infiltrated by an outside force).

text: メインバンクを読んでます 解除できません / 奴の目的は何だ / メインバスを探っています / このコードは / ヤバい! マギに侵入するつもりだ!
translation: It's reading the main bank - we can't cancel it! / What is its objective? / It's probing the main bus. / This code is... / This is bad! It intends to infiltrate MAGI!
grammar: 〜つもりだ expresses intention. ヤバい is slang for 'dangerous/bad' (or 'awesome' in modern casual use).

text: Ioシステムをダウンしろ
translation: Shut down the I/O system!
grammar: しろ is the imperative form of する, used for direct commands. Very forceful and urgent.

text: カウントどうぞ! / 3、2、1!
translation: Begin countdown! / 3, 2, 1!
grammar: どうぞ here functions as 'go ahead' or 'please proceed', giving permission to start.

text: 弦弦が切れません! / シト、さらに侵入! レルピオレに接触しました!
translation: The connection won't disconnect! / The Angel is infiltrating further! It's contacted Melchior!
grammar: 〜ません shows negative potential - 'cannot cut/disconnect'. さらに intensifies the ongoing action.

text: ダメです! シトに乗っ取られます!
translation: No good! It's being taken over by the Angel!

vocabulary.meaning: to take over, to hijack, to seize control

grammar: 乗っ取られます is passive form indicating the subject (MAGI) will be taken over by the Angel.

text: メルキオール、使徒にリプログラムされました
translation: Melchior has been reprogrammed by the Angel.
grammar: Passive construction に...されました shows the Angel (使徒) as the agent performing the action on Melchior.

text: 人工地のメルキオールより、 / 自立自爆が提訴されました / 秘訣、 / 秘訣、秘訣
translation: From the AI Melchior, / self-destruct has been proposed. / Denied. / Denied, denied.
grammar: より is formal equivalent of から meaning 'from'. されました is passive showing the proposal was made.

text: こ、今度はメルキオールがバルタザールをハッキングしています
translation: N-now Melchior is hacking Balthasar!
grammar: The stuttering こ、今度 shows the speaker's shock and distress. ています shows ongoing action.

text: くそ、早い
translation: Damn, it's fast!
grammar: Minimal sentence structure typical of urgent situations - just expletive + adjective.

text: なんて計算することだ
translation: What incredible processing speed!
grammar: なんて...ことだ is an exclamatory pattern expressing amazement or disbelief at something.

text: ロジックモードを変更 / シンクロコードを15秒単位にして / 了解
translation: Change the logic mode. / Set the sync code to 15-second intervals. / Understood.
grammar: 〜にして means 'set to' or 'make it into'. 単位 after a time expression indicates intervals.

text: どのくらい持ちそうだ / 今までのスピードから見て / 2時間くらいは / マギが / 敵に回るとはな
translation: How long do you think we can hold out? / Judging from the speed so far... / About 2 hours. / To think MAGI would become our enemy...
grammar: 〜とはな is a sentence ending expressing surprise or disbelief at an unexpected situation. 敵に回る means 'to turn into an enemy'.

text: 彼らはマイクロマシン 細菌体制の使徒と考えられます
translation: They can be considered micro-machines - an Angel in bacterial form.

vocabulary.meaning: can be considered, thought to be

grammar: 〜と考えられます is passive potential meaning 'can be thought of as' - formal analytical language.

text: その個体が集まって群れを作り / この短時間で知能回路の形成に至るまで 爆発的な進化を遂げています / 進化か / はい
translation: Those individual units gather and form swarms, / and in this short time have achieved explosive evolution to the point of forming intelligence circuits. / Evolution, huh? / Yes.
grammar: 〜に至るまで means 'to the point of reaching'. 爆発的な is な-adjective meaning 'explosive'.

text: 彼らは常に自分自身を変化させ / いかなる状況にも対処するシステムを模索しています / まさに生物の生きるためのシステムそのものだな / 事故の弱点を克服
translation: They constantly change themselves / and are seeking a system to deal with any situation. / That's exactly what a living organism's survival system is. / Overcoming their own weaknesses.
grammar: いかなる〜にも means 'in any (situation)' - formal/literary expression. まさに emphasizes 'exactly' or 'precisely'.

text: 進化を続ける目標に対して有効な手段は / 死なばもろとも
translation: An effective means against a target that continues to evolve... / If we die, we take it with us.
grammar: 死なばもろとも is a classical expression meaning 'if we die, we die together' - mutual destruction. 死なば is classical conditional of 死ぬ.
